text: Golden color with a medium white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Toast, pils malt, grass, toffee, crisp finish.

Hazy golden color. Frothy white head. I thought the nose had considerable brett though no indication its used in this beer. , biscuity nose with some dry grassy and lemon notes. Dry, the body is slightly lacking and there isnt enough bitterness. Bone bone dry mouth. Dry finish with lingering brett and oak character. Very different take on a pils. I like but dont love it
Draft. A clear pils. Aroma is earthy briney. Flavor is herbal and orange juicy. Not bad.italian style pilsener where did you get that from you dumbfucks?

Draft at Harbor Bar. 
Clean aroma of Pilsener malt, grassy hop, herbal and peppery notes. 
Clear gold pour with a thin white head and some light, sticky lace. 
Drinks clean and a little sweet, soft bitterness, lively feel. Crisp, mid-dry close. 
Pretty good.

10th rater. What makes this Italian style? Do you have to use a lot of gestures when talking about it? It is a softer and thicker mouthfeel. Pale clear gold color. Is that make it Italian? It has no pizza or pasta... hmm, Im skeptical. Malty beer for a pils, thick white Wonder bread. Light hop touches peek through. Soft malt and cottony finish.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Sampler at ginger man Boston. Pours yellow with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Solid grass notes on the nose. Solid grassiness on the tongue. Finished clean. Nice version of style.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a small white head. Aroma is very sweet with grass, grain, and biscuits. Taste is lightly tart. Bread, grass, some acidity, lemon, and a hint of pepper. Some bitterness. Light-medium body. Prickly carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Draft at Khyber Pass. Hazy gold pour with some dissipating fizzy white foam. No lace. Soft grassy lemon flavors. Oyster crackers. Celery hearts. Straw. Grapevines. Coriander. Apples. Honey. White pepper. Mozzarella. Sweat and dew. Solid. Easy drinking. Well done.

Tap. Pours fairly hazy golden, medium white head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is super light, hints of lemon, lemongrass, grain, biscuit, tangerine. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, citrus and grains, biscuit. Light body. Clean with a nice accent. Really good drinker.
Keg at Novare Res. Hazy golden, large creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of white bread, grassy hop. Taste is lemon, grass, pale bready malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness, well balanced.
Draft. Crystal clear golden color, medium white head. Aroma of biscuits and white pepper. Taste is crisp and clean.
Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration Boston. Comes a clear golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, grass, and citrus. Taste is malt, grass, citrus, and a bit of spice. Very good.
Light golden two fingers of foam. Crisp clean, layers of biscuit, floral hops, grass and a hint of citrus. Nice balance of malt and bitterness. Crusher.

Draught at the Portland location, 10/21/16.Clear, pale-brass with a good deal of fine bubbles rising to create a small, yet modestly-well retained white head.Great minerality in the nose with light sourdough notes and a strong herbal character to it that goes so far as to become lightly citrusy. Notes of white grape, light pepper and soft apples also enter in to the aroma and overall its a very snappy, bright, lightly fruity nose without any resin, alcohol or flaw. Seemingly quite dry from the nose, as well.Dry indeed in the mouth, yet with ample maltiness in the texture with light residual sugars, as well. Grassy, herbal, lightly sweaty hops add lemon and white grape notes that add complexity and enjoyable fruitiness to the dry, herbal, peppery character. Light to moderate bitterness, enough to balance and keep things crisp with strong, but tight carbonation. Delicate and awesome.
